etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Leigh Hunt (1784–1859), poet, journalist, and literary critic. From pastoral + -ize

definitions: To compose pastoral poetry; to write a pastoral.
To put into or celebrate in a pastoral.
To make pastoral or rural; specifically to deindustrialize.

notes.text: Now only with reference to the plan to deindustrialize Germany after the Second World War (1939–45).
